title: What are the biggest scams and frauds today? - Quora

response.answer_text: My 4 year old nephew came out of room, with talcum powder applied all over his face. All my relatives including myself couldn't control our laughs. We enjoyed his childish behavior. Further, I came to know that his grand-mother praises a neighborhood child of his age, for his beauty and fairness a lot. And that is why my nephew did this. Now you know the psychological impact going in his mind. He barely speaks broken words, has not completed his Play-Group schooling . Yet he understands fair is beautiful! And that is the biggest fraud and scam going openly and which we all accept! We must stop this:   This is the worst thing to happen to anyone of any age. Not just a child. But when our children see TVs and these advertisements. It just conveys them, that Life isn't Fair for them..if they are not FAIR! We not just acknowledge but celebrate this color racism. We celebrate it through television shows, through movies, through our so called 'Movie Stars'. Be it Hollywood, Bollywood and Tollywood. We all are color racists! And this creates a multi billion dollar fraud for companies who slowly and effectively insert the ill-mannered thought of FAIR color in our minds. So much that it doesn't even look or feel inappropriate. If we feel uncomfortable with cigarette, liquor, drugs advertisements. Why we openly accept this fraud? Funny thing: My few friends who are Americans, Germans, Israeli. Use same brands for exactly opposite reasons! They use creams to get tanned!  Isn't it ridiculous!

One of the biggest scams today is the millionaire scam of Instagram forex traders. Watch the video below, or keep reading to understand how it works:  If you are reading this answer, you probably already had a friend trying to convince you to join a forex trading project that can change your life financially. Possibly advertising has also appeared on your Instagram account of young people who call themselves forex traders and who want to explain to you how you too can become rich through forex trading. In this answer, I will talk about how these millionaire businesses headed by teenagers on Instagram work, and why, in my opinion, no one should trust these services. Leave your reaction at the end - if this answer gets traction, I will transform it into a video so that it can more easily reach its target audience - the people, mostly teenagers and young professionals, that can get scammed. Comments and suggestions are welcome! The army of Instagram forex traders Well, there are thousands (if not millions) of instagram accounts of young people who pretend to be professional forex traders and who show a luxurious, dream lifestyle, with high-end cars, money, frequenting expensive location, all this is possible by working in the forex market from your mobile phone or laptop, often in front of the beach or by the pool.  Then, they try to convince their followers to follow their forex strategies, saying that they can quickly double or triple their investment. I started following some of these accounts on Instagram out of curiosity, and because a friend of mine had already lost 800€ by falling into such a scheme. All of a sudden, an army of traders appeared asking to follow me on Instagram and DM’ing me. Yes, dozens of profiles trying to convince me to follow their forex strategies, telling me that it was easy and that I would quickly double my money. These people hide behind an Instagram account, and most of the time don’t even show their true identity (just first name or a fake name). The process was simple, I just had to: Start to register in the broker that they recommend (the platform where I’d do the forex trading) through their link.Then, I just had to follow their free signals, which means copying the trades that they send you to a group.Is it that easy? You just copy their trades and double your investment? What do they gain when offering their lucrative trades for free? Let’s start by the end. Are these people making a lot of money? Yes, the truth is that they are. Some of them are making millions. But they aren’t making money trading forex - they are making money getting clients to brokers (the platforms/companies where they tell you to invest). What happens is that when you register in the broker that they recommend (most of the cases BDswiss, one of the most expensive in the market), they make money by sending clients to this platform. Just so you know, they can make up to 150€ for each client that deposits 350€. This value, of course, is negotiable, and depends on each agreement - it can be considerably more. Imagine a group with 10,000 people, where those 10,000 people have registered and deposited in the broker that the trader recommended. That is half a million euros that the owner of the group makes if he makes 150€ with each client. There are groups with more and fewer followers, but you get the idea.  The truth is that this is happening today, with millions of people falling into the trap and losing their life savings, thinking that they will become rich quickly. Here is feedback from another professional in this area:  Where do the trades that they offer in their groups come from? After doing some research in forums, I realized that some of these groups are copy-past of other forex groups. The trades are, because of this, from the analysis of other professionals.  A small minority of these traders do their analysis and send their own signals. But I believe that there are very few and that the ones who do it are not only on Instagram or telegram. Copying their strategies is profitable? The truth is that yes: it can be profitable to copy signals sent by professional traders. There are huge companies in the financial industry whose business model is based on this. However, you shouldn’t copy forex signals from these groups: there is a huge risk involved and there are already better alternatives in the market. Besides that, most of these groups are untrustworthy and will only make you lose money. You shouldn’t expect to make the kind of returns that are promised on Instagram - keep reading to see how much you can make realistically with this type of activity. You shouldn’t copy forex signals from these groups manually The first problem when copying signals from these groups is that you probably won’t be able to verify past returns from the trader. Thus, you can’t know if he is a true professional or if he is just lying to you. He can say that he had a 1000% return in the previous year, that you will double your investment in a week, and tell you to see the feedback from his clients in his profile. However, there is no independent authority that confirms it, and that lets you check his past performance in detail. He can be just another scammer trying to get the commission from the broker Besides that, manually copying the trades takes a lot of time and work, and when you place the trade, the price probably already changed a lot, and probably it isn’t good to copy the trade anymore. Finally, we can talk about the returns: Most of these traders promise unrealistic returns. If you want to check the verified past returns of professional forex traders, you can in social trading platforms - here is a link with some of the leading social trading platforms in Europe (disclaimer: this is my site, it is part of a project that I started a year ago - check it out in my profile and send me your feedback). You will probably be surprised by the returns of these traders. In the image below, you have an example of professional traders and their performances in one of the copy trading platforms.  As you can see, the followers' profits are in the range of 10-20% a year - and I selected the most profitable traders on the platform! Profits above 30% of your investment per year are very difficult to obtain and probably due to luck or high risk - I challenge anyone who shows me a trader with + 30% return over 5 years, who has shared the strategy with the followers for free. Even one of the most famous investors in the world, the legendary Warren Buffet, "only" has generated an average of 20% return per year, on average, since he started his career in 1965. And yet, he became a billionaire and is considered by many "the biggest investor in the world". Here is a table with the returns from Buffet through Berkshire Hathaway, decade by decade (I took from this site: Buffett’s Performance by Decade):  So when it seems too good to be true, it is best to be prudent and investigate thoroughly. To conclude Copying forex traders may seem like an easy way to make money over the Internet, but it isn't. Some people try to profit in this way by allocating a portion of their investments to traders who operate for themselves. However, it is necessary to know what you are doing. Learn and continue to learn. Study the basic terms, practice with a demo account, study the traders' strategies and form your own strategies. Although there are already companies exploring this space, it is still a consolidating market. If you decide to copy another person, do thorough research, and try to find out if that person is trustworthy. There are lots of online forums where people exchange their experiences. Also, test the strategy at least 1–2 months to check if the returns match. Even if you don't have a big profit, it is a way to learn, especially if each trade comes with the analyst's explanation. Finally, run away from sites and people that promise unbelievable results. If it sounds too good to be true, think twice!

FAKE DATING AND HOOK-UP ANDROID APPS ON GOOGLE PLAY STORE..!! Well… You just heard me. It’s true. Google Play Store is filled with fake dating apps that claims to provide services of dating/chatting/meet-up etc. But most of them are fake as fu*k..!! Now let me tell You, these Apps are rated 4.0 and above on Play Store..!! Now You will ask me Apps are rated 4.0 and above and I’m saying they are fake. How is it possible…??! Let me explain. Only a few weeks ago I installed Tinder App on my smartphone. No.. Tinder is a legit App worldwide.. No issues with Tinder.. ;) BUT, You might have noticed when You install a certain App on your smartphone, Play Store gives You a list of Similar Apps to that of one You just downloaded/installed. So, after I installed Tinder, I saw a recommendation of lot of other Apps. So, i just casually opened their home pages (those other Apps) and checked out what they are all about. Almost all Apps guaranteeing they provide legit profiles of gender matches. I even saw they have rating over 4.0. BUT the reality revealed as I visited the comment section. I noticed that the people who have rated the App 4 or 5 star etc. i) Do not have a valid profile. 99% of them have the name “A Google User”. ii) Needless to say, these have got no profile pics..!! iii) And they would not comment anything at all and only rate 5 stars..!! Further I saw that there are legit users/profiles who have given 1 star rating to the App. Now these are all real people with valid profiles. Most of them were complaining that for sending message to someone in the opposite gender the App asks them to be a premium user. Now, when they paid a subscription fee and became a premium user. Then also they were not able to send any message. And most interesting part is although they have paid a subscription fee for say 1 month or 3 month basis, their account expired in 7–10 days of paying their money !!! And page after page in Review section, I would see fake profiles giving a 4 star or 5 star rating and real users giving reviews about how they got frustrated and conned by using this App. And again curiously I checked out some other similar Apps with 4 star and above ratings. And scenario was exactly the same as before mentioned Apps. You might be thinking I’m just saying like this. No, I got screenshots to prove my points. Here take a look for Yourself.     So, now You got the proof.. ??! Most of these Apps claim to be free but when You install them, You will see the option of In-app purchases. (which is actually the above mentioned premium these fake/cheat Apps charge). And when real legit users complaint after getting cheated the people representing the App only say One has to be premium user to get in touch with real profiles..!!And if any one is got cheated, they will look into the matter. And they keep looking forever. And also they claim to be free but they ask for credit card details. I am wondering how on first place these scam and fake Apps got the permission to be hosted on Google Play Store…??! It’s not easy to get an App bypass all security checks and stuffs to be allowed to hosted over Google Play Store. (yes it’s not that easy..!!) And they are being shown in the similar Apps when You install legit Apps like Tinder only because these fake Apps have fake 4 or 5 starred rating. This is such a clever no no.. I would rather say a cunning scam being run by these Apps to cheat people and take their money..!! This goes unnoticed but it is one of the most circulating scam/fraud these days. Be careful before using such Apps and do not go by the ratings. Take Your time to read the comments once.

The biggest scam I saw was of a friend of mine who wanted to invest in the online trading market last year. He started trading with olymptrade and made the first deposit of 560USD and from there he realize he’s been cheated.Before he spoke to one Mr. Ryan Jeffery, with him he started to deposit money because he saw that the system worked in the right way, the only doubt he had was that it insistently required money on the bill but his work as a trader did it. And he started to trust him and have deposited around 36,000USD. After continuous requests for money, at the end he told him he was not going to put money anymore. After a couple of days he told him that he changed his position and became a higher level and could only manage accounts of 145,000USD upward. He told him that if he did not pay he would have to move on to another trader. So after a very positive last transaction, he passed him to one Mr. Carrick Peter. At that point he had invest about 38,500USD. In one day Derek brought the position to 40,000USD so he asked for his first withdrawal of 2,500USD which they sent to him. So he continued working with him.After few weeks of working with him he asked for a second withdrawal of about 5,000USD for further proof. In 4hours it ran out of 37,000USD, which he had already invested. So he tried to contact Mr Ryan who "offered" to help him. He sent him an agreement in which he tells him that they will put 30,000USD on the trading account, but that HE CAN NOT RETIRE. He can continue trading, but until he have gained 5 times, he won’t be able to withdraw his money, without any help from them that is when he realize that he had been scammed. We tried reporting to the FBI and explained everything to them but we got nothing, so we checked online to see if we can get some help that is when we came across rapidfix. Tech . We sent them a mail and chatted with them and we were assigned an agent who took our case with all the provided evidence and proof we sent her. After weeks of professional approach to the case they were able to help us in recovering his lost money. If I'm to guarantee anyone a reliable recovery company I would tell them to go through rapidfix. Tech because of how they handle all their cases professionally.

THE FRAUD ALREADY HAPPENS IN MUMBAI. A person received a call from some stranger who claims that he belongs to prepaid service provider and ask him to switch off his phone for 2 hours for some 3G updates to take place. As the person was already in a rush for an urgent meeting so he didn’t question and switched off his smart phone. After 45 mins. He felt something fishy as the person didn’t give the introduction properly. He switched on the phone and got the notification or several missed call from his family members and some of it from the same caller. He called his home number and was astonished as they are asking him whether he is safe or not. They explained him that some one called them and claims that they have kidnapped him and forced them to send money to set him free. And, It was so real that they have to believe. They could able to hear his loud cry voice for help . The person’s father was at bank queue and was just waiting for money transfer to the kidnapper account A complain was filed against the imposter. To the surprise, again he received another call from the same guy asking to shutdown the cell phone for another 1 hour but he refused. They kept calling his cell phone until the battery had run down. The incident was informed to the police officer . There were many such scams reported. MOST of the cases reported that the victim had already transferred the money...! And, It is impossible to get back the money. Be careful as this kind of scam might happen to any of us...!!! Those guys are so professional and very convincing during calls. If you are asked to shut down your cell phone for updates by the service provider, ASK AROUND...! Your family or friends might receive the same call. Be Safe and Stay Alert...!

Not a fraud or scam in true sense, but a clever trick which food outlets use to make you spend some extra money. How many times it has happened with you when you are at a food outlet and after placing your order the attendant asks you whether you want something extra like cheese or cookies or topping or dessert etc? If yes, and you have agreed to have that extra then you are also a victim of a classic clever trick. I will further elaborate with examples. At McDonalds:- Attendant: Namaste. What would you like to order Sir? Me: A Maharaja Mac Junior and small fries. A: Would you like to convert the order into a value meal with Rs. 20 extra and you will get a additional soft drink? M: Ok. (The soft drink would cost me Rs. 60 if ordered separately) This way he was able to make me spend more. I happily leave the counter thinking I saved Rs. 40 but actually I am at a loss of Rs. 20. *Another one* A: Namaste. What would you like to order Sir? M: A Maharaja Mac Junior A: Would you like to have with cheese or without cheese? Note: They don't use the word ‘extra cheese’. M: With cheese. Who doesn't want cheese in their burger? So I agree to it. The extra cheese is nothing but only a cheese slice like one available in the market and i paid Rs. 20 for that. And the sad part is the cheese was not even required, the burger already has mayonnaise and other sauces so the taste was same. At Keventers Milkshake :- A: Hello Sir, what will you like to have? M: One mint-oreo shake, small. A: Will you like to have more cookie pieces? Note: Here he mentioned extra pieces. M: Yes. (immediately) Who drinks an oreo shake without cookie pieces? I agreed and was charged Rs. 25 for it. The sad part is the shake’s taste was the same. The extra cookies didn't make any difference. He hardly put in 2 biscuits which would have just cost them Rs. 5 or less. Moral: Don't fall prey to such tricks. Next time when you are asked for something extra say NO immediately. Then think over if you really want that extra. They will always be pleased to change your order if you are willing to pay more.

This is a story related to an Indian person , many of which may be found in other places of India too. Also, the whole country cannot be blamed in account of a few people. Here goes the incidences happening with foreign tourists in India. It happened when I was working in a hotel as a receptionist. Below is my picture when I was working in the hotel.  Image Source:- My phone Gallery An elderly foreign couple came to our hotel without reservation to check-in, the time I was working. I checked the reservations and Informed them that their rooms were not reserved. They showed me papers of the hotel booking by their agent who claimed to have reserved the rooms. A little background to this story : They flew from their country to Delhi directly. In Delhi they meet an agent who offers a full package tour of India, including transportation & accommodation. For which they pay him a sum of one lakh. But he dosent book anything for them, he just books the train tickets. They travel from Delhi to Aurangabad. I asked them to call the person who claims to be managing their tour. I took the number from them and called him as they did not have an Indian number. His number constantly came as switched off. The couple were tired as they were traveling more than 24 hrs. So I asked them you can do check-in first, we will contact him after sometime. After I finished the formalities they checked into the room. Just before going to the room I asked them for a visiting card of that agent hoping to find something on the internet. I searched for the tours & travels and after some websites I got his alternative number. I contacted him and asked him about the mis-booking and malpractice. He was shouting at me for calling, questioning where I got this number and asked me to never call again. I did still give the number to the couple. He did not pick the call number of times after this incident, we had to try calling from my colleague’s phone just to make him answer. When that foreigner asked him about the booking, he apologized profusely saying he had forgotten about it. He offered to pay the hotel money online and asked for bank details. After sharing the details on WhatsApp, the number was again not available. Meanwhile the guest wanted to explore Ajanta & ellora caves and then travel to Karnataka.They were having enough funds & credit cards to easily explore India without the agent. I arranged the transportation services for them to Ajanta & Ellora, booked a hotel in Karnataka and their return tickets from Aurangabad to Karnataka. After 2 days they check-out from our hotel and pay all bills and transportation charges. In that 2 days we tried to contact that agent but his number wasn't connecting at all. I also tried to get information from my source but couldn't get any details of that tours & Travels. The couple were very happy with our service as we helped them beyond our duty. The thanked us profusely and processed with their journey. But the worst part is the fraud that agent committed. They lost approximately one lakh rupees and faced so many challenges in booking tickets and hotels. I feel very bad when the foreigner said this “I WILL NEVER TRUST ANY INDIAN’S WORD” I didn't know what to say and stood with my head bent like a criminal. So I think such type of things(fraud) should stop immediately in india. Just think if they didn't having enough fund so what would they have done?? Thanks to reading. Cheers ❤️❤️ दुआ में याद रखना 🤲🤲(Remember in prayers)

Rental Scam Recently, I was looking for a flat (rent) in Mumbai suburbs. So after shortlisting some flats from India Real Estate Property Site ; me and my husband decided to visit some flats. We visited one flat which was shown us by the flat’s owner (impostor). So as we entered the flat, first thing I noticed that there was no name plate on door . Anyway we neglected it and proceeded to check the flat. We liked the flat and wanted to book it asap. As it was completely steal deal for us. Also, Owner was also very flexible with everything we demanded (like, he accepted to give us flat in 22k despite the rates for renting flats were more than 25k in that society and also we wanted modular kitchen, he was ready to make kitchen of our choice and in our designs etc). He demanded the full month rent as token money to book the flat (he insisted to transfer the money on same day itself). We were ready to transfer the money online not the same day but the next day and he somewhat agreed. But very next day he started insisting to transfer the money asap by texting or calling every now and then. Luckily, my husband was busy in his office work that day and he didn't get time to transfer the money. Then also things were looking okay however we had a doubt in our mind that ‘why the owner is giving us flat in such such a low rate?’ So we searched the owner's details on social media (as I find it the quickest way) and about his profession also. We were not able to find him. We were very much confused (until now we didn't give him any token money). Then next day we visited the society's office to check the ownership of flat just to cross check. We were shocked to see that the flat which was shown to us was somebody else’s flat. Then we understood the entire story. Actually that person was trying to fraud us. We immediately took original owner's phone number from the society as we find it our responsibility to tell him that somebody is misusing his vacant flat. So told him the entire story and he was also shocked to listen. He immediately took action and lodged complaint in police station . And we thanked God. So please be aware while you are renting/selling/buying flat or properties. Specially don't handover keys of flat to any unknown person. For more information- Top Tips for How to Recognize and Avoid Apartment Rental Scams

Festive season in India had just started a few weeks back and boom boom - we all are being cheated in the name of discounts. But how ? Check this out : Pay attention to the two most important things here Amount : Rs 6830Manufacturing Date : 11/2015 Now the picture above displays the transparent cover used as a packaging material for the bag. What about the brand tags ? Which normally hang around every item . Now you need to observe things carefully here, but about what ? Relax ! You need to check and compare the Amount and manufacturing date again.  Wow 50% and item is also good, let me buy . But what about the comparison which we were supposed to make. Yes probably you have noticed it - they have changed: Amount : Rs 8690Manufacturing date : 06/2017 .So lets us analyse first where is the scam in this particular item bill. Is it the Amount or the Manufacturing date? Just for argument sake - can a price be changed once the item is shipped to the store or in the inventory - The answer is YES. There can be multiple reasons for this but you can check this price revision by calling the customer care too. What about manufacturing date? Can this also be changed - hahahaha NO. They made an old item a new item and latest collection just by changing the tag. Just imagine your favourite snack has an expiry of 3 months and the retailer changes the expiry by just pasting a new sticker over it. That item would never expire but your stomach would definitely give you hard times  . Thank God in my case it was a laptop bag . The big disappointment is the bag was purchased from ShopperStop and the brand was Carlton(VIP BRAND). More to be added to your disappointment: when I returned this bag, the staff argued and gave sensational statements like everyone does this in this industry and its no big deal, we will give you a new piece. More coming- they even told the salesman from next time remove all the old stickers before you give it to the customer . Learnings from the incident: they will sell the item anyways by cheating or without cheating, you need to pay extra bit of attention for saving your hard earned money. Here is the pic of the laptop bag i finally returned after fighting for the right reasons :

Larsen & Toubro (L & T) has been one of the biggest Companies in India and has a huge number of openings for job seekers. Some scammers under the name of this huge company contact a large set of people through SMS. They tell them that they have been selected for an interview by L & T and send a link of a document in the same SMS. The document is neatly prepared on the letter head of the company containing the Company's address, email, fax number, etc. It contains a hyperlink which takes us to Wikipedia for further details of the company. The flow of the document is so smooth and professional that no one will ever understand that its fraudulent. It has details about the 4 rounds of interviews, details of Openings in various departments, job locations, interview location, salary details, etc. I noticed a few grammatical mistakes which made me think twice but overall no one could ever doubt on this being fraudulent. The catch was that the company had placed the interview in Lucknow and had guaranteed for refund of travel and stay expenses. But they were demanding an amount of Rupees 9750/- as a security deposit which had to be paid through PAYTM or direct bank transfer to their Bank Account. They said it would be refunded on the day of interview. This sounded really fishy. As no employer takes a security deposit in advance. But still the overall presentation looked very professional. You can check the attached document. Later on the actual company L & T released a document stating that someone was fraudulently inciting people to apply after paying an amount as security deposit and asked the people to stay away from it. Also Recruiters contacting through SMS and not by email is fishy. Just spread the awareness. Attaching both the documents for reference. Stay safe from such scammers. (Image 1, 2, 3 are the screenshot of appeal made by scammers and Image 4 is the clarification by the Company)

The prologue first. I stay at Sector 5, SaltLake, Kolkata. It is the IT hub of Kolkata. So one fine day I needed to go outstation and so booked an UBER to howrah station (railway station) from my place, the car gets booked and the fare rs 400 approx is shown. Few moments later an Uber arrives, the car driver takes one of the longest possible routes to get out of my neighborhood , I didn’t tell him anything because I was too early for the train and had nearly 2 hours in my hand. Just before we were about to exit Sector 5 suddenly the car slowed down and abruptly stopped.  The driver gets out of the car, reaches the bonnet and after a while says the car broke down, he cannot continue the ride anymore and completes the trip (with my permission). The fare is a whooping Rs 200 just for maybe 2 kms and it was a 12.7 km ride for Rs 400 .  Now as my net was not working so the driver booked another UBER and the fare that was shown from there was Rs 350. I got up on the second uber and then explained to the new driver what had happened. After listening to me he smiled a bit and said to me “This is a new scam in UBER. There are a few drivers, who pick up people and roam around within the city, justifying why they took this route when asked and when they feel that enough fare has been billed they stage some type of drama about car failure and again look for some new ‘murga’ ”. He said that he can prove this to me, and again we reached the spot where my first Uber had a break down and it was hardly 8-10 minutes ride , the first uber car was no longer there…..!!!! This happened to many of my friends and room mates too. Have complained UBER and waiting for their answer and refund…..!!! No mail so far from Uber P.S - Got refund of Rs 176 yesterday (Can use it on other rides)…!!! Seems uber is listening…!!!

Yes Yes.. I have been waiting to answer this question for quite long.. So, this happened recently when I applied for an SBI Card and now I regret doing so. So, while applying for it, I had checked an option that said that “Whether I should be notified for Card Protection Plan” and I ticked it as Yes. Fortunately, my card got approved and then the torture began. I get a call from this gentleman (even before I received my card), that he is calling me from such and such Card Protection Plan and he started explaining me the features on it. He did not even wait for me to give a reply and he kept on speaking. And then, he came down to payment, asking me whether I would like to get it charged as a whole or as an emi. At that particular time, I asked him to send me a mail on all the features as I needed time to think. He insisted on me getting my card charged to which I refused stating that I would require a mail before I would agree to their terms and conditions. The gentleman abruptly disconnected the call without any courtesy. I thought this was over but I was wrong. I received another call the next day and I gave a similar reply and again this gentleman disconnected the call abruptly. I had to go on an international trip the next day but the calls just did not seemed to stop. I used to get calls every morning at 6 AM in Greece which is around 9:30 AM in India for my entire 10 Days of Travel When I complained the same on their Facebook Page since I did not want to make an international call, this is the reply I received.   A bunch of Automated Replies. Needless to say, the day I landed in India, I made sure to blast them on the way they behave with people. It was later that I discovered, that these people sell your personal details to other fraud companies and I have been receiving varied calls such as My Card is being upgraded or my card has been blocked. One gentleman even went ahead in responding when I asked him an email regarding to the issue, that I will receive my mail . . . . Wait for it. . . . Via Bluetooth

Amway / Brit world wide A few years ago one of our friends wanted to visit our newborn so we asked them to come home on a Sunday evening. He showed up with his family and was carrying a rather large backpack. We chatted about random stuff - politics, movies, workplace and inflation. This person also kept steering the conversation to how difficult it is to manage expenses with just our office salaries. My wife and I were neck deep in mortgages so I shared the same concerns and voila! He set up the stage, opened the large backpack and poured out Amway products, a few DVDs and a heavy photo album. He started talking about the corporation called Brit World wide and the financial gains and awesome products. We tried to interrupt but he kept going on for 2 hours. He carefully avoided using the word Amway. He opened the album and showed us pictures of IAS officers, ISRO officials and doctors who apparently quit their full time job because they made a lot more money through Amway. My wife and I were really not interested because we have known a few people who struggled after joining pyramid schemes. We were also very hungry(it was way past dinner time) and they seemed to have no intention of leaving until we signed up. I had to put my foot down and tell them that it is dinner time. They wanted to go to a restaurant so that they can continue the discussion. We told them we were going to cook our dinners and we stood up and had to keep the door open for them. Fast forward to Los Angeles- I see many of my fellow Indian couples in supermarkets who try to be nice and friendly. Within 5 minutes, they ask a TON of questions about my visa status, my workplace, my kid, her school and my address. Then they talk about how they own a “start up” and they are looking for bright young minds like mine. The first two times, I was genuinely curious and we exchanged phone numbers. But when I asked to go and check out their “office”, they always want to meet in their house for lunch on Sunday. I shared this experience with a few friends and they warned me that those are typical Amway/MLM traps. After the first two instances, I have learnt to be downright rude to such friendly couples the moment they start asking questions about my life. I also want to write about people enticing you to join cults run by Godmen but that deserves a separate answer altogether.

One of the biggest scams and frauds these days are mostly very well planned and involves a bunch of people. most of the frauds are somewhat related to monetary gains. Most common frauds are, credit card fraudStealing the card or its credential data to buy goods online or withdraw cash. also, the stolen cards are sold in the black market. Identity theft fraudsStealing the identity of a person to use it for illegal access to confidential data or places. most commonly the stolen identities are used for bank and mortgage frauds. Medical identity theft fraudStealing the medical identity of a person to get prescribed drugs and medical services free of cost. also, it is used to get the prescribed drugs to sell them in the black market. Data breachStealing the confidential data from a company's system and using that data to defraud others. take the example of TJX and Marshal’s, millions of credit card credentials were stolen from the company’s system and it lost millions of dollars to that fraud. Money laundering:Illegal transfer of money in such a way that the transfer does not leave any trail behind. many countries have introduced strict AML(Anti Money Laundering) compliances which must be followed by the concerned institutions. Investment fraudscompanies pretend to be a profit-oriented investment company but they defraud people and use the investors’ money for their personal use. investment scams were one of the biggest scams of this century. Worldcom CEO Bernard Ebbers used accounting tricks to defraud the investors while inflating the comapny’s assets by more than $10 billion. Most of these frauds could be mitigated if the companies start to introduce more security layers to their systems, for example, using KYC and AML compliance services, adding more strong antiviruses to the systems. Individuals could reduce their risk by; not sharing their personal information online, by regular check of their credit card and bank account details and lastly by informing the authorities urgently in case there has been any suspicious activity in their account or it has been hacked.

Instead of reffering a particular scam, I will try to mention the common types to cover more ground. Beggar’s Scam: A poor looking chap or family will come upto you and ask for money for food or transport ticket with some escuse like a lost wallet or lack of funds. I suggest you offer them in kind and buy food or ticket for them if you are feeling genourous. Bait and switch Scam: Someone will offer you something really expensive like a smart phone at a really cheap price. They may let you inspect it as well but if they do they will always ask you to hand it back to them even if you decide to pay. Once you do they will give you a well pakaged and difficult to open box and by the time you open it to find that you have been scammed they will be long gone. Networking Scam: Some firm ask you to sign up and pay an amount and you get paid by the number of other members you recruit. They just pay their previous members by the money they make from new one's and once the bubble burst so will the payment. Online retailers: we wary of unknown online retailers who do not offer cash on arrival. Even if they do deliver genuine products the chances are they will be overpriced and cheaply available on a popular counterpart. Call based scam: Be suspicious when any one calls/messages you, praise your looks/talents or offer you a product/job and ask for some amount in advance. A good way to judge is to consider the possibility that if you are scammed, how much will they earn vs how much do they invest. In you think their investment is low had the the whole thing being a scam and profit high. Then it is a scam.

CA student creates 115 fake companies to commit ₹50.24 cr GST fraud, student held for ‘floating fake firms’.  A 25-year-old student of chartered accountancy (CA) was arrested by the goods and services tax (GST) officials for committing fraud to the tune of Rs 50.24 crore through input tax credit (ITC) facility. Prince Manish Kumar Khatri, a resident of Ahmedabad, was arrested by the CGST-II, Vadodara after it learnt about his fraud during data analysis of the suspicious taxpayers. GST officials said that Khatri had floated more than 115 fake firms for executing the fraud. He made fake invoices to generate ITC amounting to Rs 50.24 crore. The illegal and fake credit was eventually passed on in chains to other fake firms without any actual supply of goods and services. Khatri told GST officials that he used identity cards of villagers from Dahod and Ahmedabad to create the fake firms. He had promised the villagers a monthly payment of cash. During questioning, Prince Manish Kumar Khatri is said to have admitted that he used identities of villagers and labourers from Ahmedabad and Dahod, promising them monthly payment in cash, officials said. Khatri used to work for a firm and dealt with several companies. “Khatri admitted that he made a web of fake firms to benefit some existing and real companies.,” a GST official said. Source from: CA student held for Rs 50 crore GST fraud | Vadodara News - Times of India

I read 28 of the answers and was very disappointed. None of the people who tried to answer even attempted to quantify the scam or fraud they decided to describe as “big” or “biggest” in any meaningful way. It appears they were answering another question, “what is the most annoying fraud you ever encountered” and even that was hardly answered. One guy wrote about how a package of chewing gum at twice the size was 5 times higher in price. What a tiny fraud that is! Chewing gum? Really?! A big fraud was the Bernie Madoff scandal. The size of that fraud was $64.8 billion if you trust the wikipedia reference to the Wall St. Journal, and Reuters new reports. I would have thought some people might have pointed to paper money itself, since then you can quantify that as a very large fraud. Paper money in the USA used to be a promise to pay a certain amount of silver, on demand. So, since it no longer is such a promise, it is a defaulted promise, and thus a fraud. You could estimate US paper money fraud as high as a few trillion dollars, such as all the money issued by the Federal Reserve that is in circulation. This used to be called M1, a measure of the money supply, but statistics on this ended over ten years ago. But then, there is a bigger fraud, but this brings us to fractional reserve banking; because banks don’t even have all the money that they claim to have, to even back up the money in your account. This number might be as high as an $10 to $15 trillion fraud, hard to say, they used to count this as M2. A bigger fraud would be to add bonds into the mix, this would be M3, perhaps an $25 trillion fraud. Bonds are simply another promise to pay paper money. (note the trend, these are all promises to pay more money than exists). A far bigger fraud is “interest rate derivatives”. These are bets on the value of bonds, such as futures on bonds, or options on bond prices. Or perhaps they are variable interest rate derivatives, or “inflation indexed loans” of any kind. These used to be a $400 trillion monster, but that was 5 years ago. I think that’s the biggest fraud if you want to count in terms of “paper money”. But there are other ways to count. What if we counted by “number of people deceived” by the fraud, or idea? We could then count things like: global warming, evolution, Paul the False apostle, or any number of false religious ideas. What if government itself is a fraud? Would you count every person in every territory controlled by a government, or would you only count people who vote? Or would you count people who pay taxes, or who receive services? What if healthcare as practiced today in the USA, because it’s all based on government monopoly granted patented toxic prescription medicines, is a fraud? What if an entire religion was a fraud?

Bus conductors I used to travel in BMTC bus for 4 years continuously from my house to college. I had to take 2 buses to reach my college. I stay in the heart of Bangalore where people are more educated and well informed ( just mentioning it for further reference.. not trying to degrade anyone or any place). Three fourth of my journey was by first bus. I had to change the bus somewhere close to my college which is situated away from the city. There were a number of villages around my college. Now comes the actual part, whenever the conductor found an old person from a village or to be more precise a less informed person who had no knowledge about where the ticket fare goes to and about taxes, he used to take just half the amount of the actual ticket but not provide the ticket. He used to also have a backup plan where sometimes he used to give tickets to people but receive it back and return half the amount when they were just about to get down. This ticket he used use for many more such customers. I once even heard a woman telling the conductor that she had no better thing to do with ticket other than throwing after getting down. So why waste paper? Ha Ha.... Save trees..... what a thought!!! These conductors just make use of people's ignorance to encash their needs! This may seem a petty amount but imagine he meets hundreds of such people everyday. But not all conductors were like that. I've seen the most obedient and dedicated ones too. Hats off to such conductors who have so much of patience.

The Octa-core phone scam Octa core should mean twice the speed of quad core, right? Let’s see some of the specifications of phones which boast of having “8 core processors”.  Samsung Galaxy Note 8: Octa-core (4x2.3 GHz & 4x1.7 GHz) Huawei Honor 9: Octa-core (4x2.4 GHz Cortex-A73 & 4x1.8 GHz Cortex-A53) Google Pixel 2 XL: Octa-core (4x2.35 GHz Kryo & 4x1.9 GHz Kryo) LeEco Le 2: Octa-core (4x1.8 GHz Cortex-A72 & 4x1.4 GHz Cortex-A53) Noticed something? Not all cores are of same frequency. 4 out of 8 have considerably lower frequency. Why this difference in frequencies? We can increase the frequency of any processor only up to a certain point. After that, the heat generated by the processor is too high for it to function properly, nor will the processor have a long life. Also, as opposed to PC’s or laptops, mobile phones have space constraint due to which having a fan is not possible. Having 8 cores of the same high frequency also bring in these problems. Another problem with 8 high frequency cores is that they will drain your battery pretty quickly and we all know how awful cell phone battery life is. For this reason, processor companies follow what is called as the big.LITTLE architecture for processors. In this architecture, 4 cores are of high frequency and 4 are of low frequency. What’s the use? It helps in saving battery and makes the phone more efficient. You do not need high processing power all the time when you use phone. Checking time, date news, or just scrolling the apps you have require very less amount of processing power. If we use powerful processors for these basic tasks, the only thing it will do faster is drain your battery. Creating or editing a video, taking photos in burst mode, slo-mo videos or playing games can make use of these high frequency cores to give you a seamless, lag free experience. You are not going to do these things as frequently as checking time, so it makes sense to have cores with lesser frequency to do these tasks. I say it’s a scam because phone companies do not tell you about it outright. It’s only when you read the fine print you come to know about it. Having a quad core processor with 2.4GHz frequency and an octa core processor with 4x2.4GHz and 4x1.7GHz won’t double your speed. It will be almost same with a better battery life on the octa core phone if everything else is same. Hope this helps!

During this Dusshera, I visited my relative’s place in Bangalore. It was 11 o clock in the night when i reached KSR Railway station. Since it was the festival day and also because it was raining, many cabs were not available. But I wanted to get an uber or ola since local autos charge too much. And also since it was raining, they would loot money how much ever they want.  So I was trying to book ola and after repeatedly trying, finally I got a cab. Remember 1 thing, I booked an “OLA PRIME” cab. So the driver arrived and myself and my family got in. He asked for OTP and I gave it. He started the cab. But now comes the actual story. He doubtfully turned back and asked me “Which cab did u book?” I said “OLA PRIME”. He then said this is “OLA SUV” and not “PRIME”. He further said that the rate for SUV would be twice that of prime and would cost about rs.400 to reach my destination. I initially didn't believe in that because I have not seen any “OLA SUV” option in the app, but after he mentioned the rate, I thought “Its ok, let me book another cab”. Then we all got down. Yes, a rider cannot end the ride! After 10 minutes I received a bill of rs.150. Luckily I didn't have any OLA Money., otherwise I would have lost rs.150!!! When I called him he didn't pick up his phone!(obviously!) Also the OLA Support is another useless thing! They too didn't pickup my phone call….CHEAP!!!VERY CHEAP!!!! This is a new scam which I dint even come across on quora or anywhere else. So i thought its worth sharing! So people be careful! Edit: WOW! thanks people for 1000+ Upvotes. Cash backs on your debit and credit cards.  When these huge brands and online platforms offer you cash back on a particular bank’s debit or credit card, they will never mention the date the cash back will be redeemed. It is usually 3–4 months after the purchase. So, lets say you bought a phone from flipdeal or snapkart in September for 20,000 and cash back is around 2,000 on ICFC bank cards. You will have to pay 20,000 only at the time of purchase. The promised cash back will be on January 31st. Now, most of us will not even remember three months later that we were supposed to get a casback. This has happened with me on two different occasions and with people I know as well. Unless, you remember and enquiry up with the customer care, the cash back is never processed. I do agree that there are a few honest ones out there who do give the cash back on time as well. But just imagine, the amount of interest in bank the bank/seller would have earned from the total amalgamation of all the cash backs in those three months. A marketing hype, a scam and a clever business plan all wrapped into one. Edit 1: I do understand many guys have been rewarded the cash back. I mentioned my experiences and from people I have heard of. there have been instances where it was not given back.

The biggest scam I have seen is where petrol pump takes advantage of your inattentiveness. The Scam: Part 1. When you say the amount like Five hundred, they will start filling your tank without confirming the amount. Before starting he will ask you to verify that he is starting from zero saying "See zero on the meter" something like this. Part 2. Then they will stop at 100. You will say that you said 500 previously. That time he will engage you in words like "Sorry, I didn't hear you properly for the first time." and will start to pour in Fuel. This time he will not make sure you can not verify that he is starting from zero either engaging you in conversation or blocking your view of the counter screen. Part 3. This is the last and final step to make a fool of you and scam you. He will stop at 400 and will say "Previously 100 and now 400, 500 is done now." and will ask you to pay 500. The Trick:What he did is he didn't reset the counter after filling the 100 Rs worth of fuel. At the time of filling the rest of the amount he started from 100 to 400, that means he filled only 400 worth of fuel. He made you believe that he filled 500 worth of fuel. Even if you are guessing by seeing the fuel gauge or sensing something wrong, the behave so confidently that you will just believe in their word and leave. Human nature is that we run from confrontation so most of us will just leave with only doubt in their mind. You can find more details in my blog post on the same topic. Beware of Petrol Pump Scam (400+100) in Pune and Bangalore as well. What to do when you feel you have been scammed.

This one is an addition to already stated UBER scam in Kolkata. Not the biggest - but still a scam. Date: 7th Jan 2018 Time: 10:30 PM Place: Howrah Railway station UBER parking(In front of New station building) I booked an Uber for my pickup from HWH railway station and got a reminder that I need to pay INR 74 as pickup charges/Parking fee, and this will be included into my bill - I don’t need to pay anything in cash to the driver. I got a text message from UBER as well saying not to pay anything in cash as my mode of payment is PAYTM. When I got into cab, the driver asked me to pay the parking charges(INR 74). When I told him that Uber asked me not to pay, he told me that the rules have changed now and I need to pay the parking fee. As it was already getting late for me to reach my detination, I thought that I’ll complain to UBER and get the refund - and paid the cash. After finishing my trip, the parking charges were added to the bill as mentioned by Uber and there was no change in rule - this was the scam by the driver. When I complained to UBER, they simply refused to refund the parking fee I had paid giving a silly reason that my mode of payment was PAYTM and they can’t refund the amount paid in cash - what bullshit! Anyway, I couldn’t argue much because it was my mistake to pay him even though Uber asked me not to. Finally I asked them to create a security incident - the driver was refusing to ply without me making the payment. Assume if it was a lady hailing the cab in the middle of the night - and it was not a busy area like Railway station. Hope UBER listens !

Not sure if it comes in the biggest scams category, however it happened with me two three days back. I wanted to share so that it might save someone from fraud. A guy from an unknown number called in a desperate voice, saying have you recognized me. I tried calling out few names and he agreed with one. He gave one number, asked me to paytm the amount i.e. 2k rupees immediately. I asked what happened, he said it is his friend’s number and he met with an accident and need money asap. I asked, why aren’t you calling from your number and he said battery is down. Something was fishy, I went to truecaller, and checked that number, it was reported as a spam. Checked the other number and it was saved by name pay. I called him, and said I transferred the money but due to typo mistake I transferred 20k, kindly return the 18k and keep the 2k. He said why are you bluffing there is no money transfer. I asked you are somewhere else how come you are aware it is not transferred. He started abusing, and disconnected the call. What I did wrong, I didn’t save that number, I could have reported to police.

Cooling charges scam Cooling charges is not needed Companies such as coca cola and pepsi pay for the refrigerator. Seen the logo of fridges? Covered in Advertisements?  First of all, these refrigerators are the property of soft drink company this is why they advertise their brand. Second, These are provided free of cost to shops, including the electricity money for 10 years.(only the electricity, the fridge uses, not for all shop’s electricity bill, if fridge uses 10 KWH a day, then they pay for 10KWH per day for 10 years, 10 yeas and 10 KWH is an example, it varies as per the contract and licence for selling these it is a one time payment) So basically, cooling is free. GST is already charged, it is mentioned in the coke bottle, ₹18 coke bottle is inclusive of all taxes. (Inclusive of all taxes means the MRP is adjusted to every tax imposed excluding income tax and company tax and all) Verify for the GST IN number through https://services.gst.gov.in/serv...this link. If they force you to obey them, just leave that place, Charging more than MRP is crime, and If their bill does’nt contain correct GST number then that is not a valid Bill, No bill means the product is free for you. GST is not levied on road side vendors etc, so they don’t have to give bill! But for all the rest, they need to give you valid bill with valid GST number. EDIT: Companies do not pay for the electricity, but still it is a scam as everything is included in the MRP and selling higher than MRP is illegal.

Recently, I had encountered 2 Job related scams. As my job hunting was on at that time, I had register with many top job hunting sites from India like TimesJobs, Naukri, Indeed etc. The first one was fake offer letter from Tech Mahindra. As per their letter, they short-listed me for their walk-in interview process and asked for registration fee. Second one was actually happened to my brother-in-law. He is a Doctor in one of the top industry in India. He got offer letter from one of the hospital from Dubai. Again they were asking some fees for some stupid reasons. We even called the number they provided, and the guy on the phone told us it is genuine offer letter, although luckily we have some contacts in Dubai and we tried to verify the letter from that hospital itself and as it turns out, it was fake. The easiest way to know that the letter is fraud/ fake is - most of the time they will ask some money for registration or whatever reasons. No company is stupid enough to give anyone offer letter without interview process and this kind of process takes many weeks(mostly). Also no company will ever ask money for registration or interview process. so, Stay alert.

I got a call from a person saying he’s calling from my bank (he didn’t mention name of the bank) regarding my debit card. As it happens, the same day my father’s debit card was expired so I called his bank to know the procedure of renewal, so I didn’t realize it was a scam and thought it was a call back regarding my father’s debit card. But then he asked for CVV number ( the one on back of your card, usually besides black magnetic strip ), which was definitely unusual as they shouldn’t be asking information such as OTPs and CVV number. I started questioning him about which bank he’s calling from and told him I have account with different banks and both of my debit cards are expired Instead of answering my question he asked about in which banks I hold an account, now I was sure this was scam call. But I kept asking him, which bank you’re calling from, and finally he said I’m calling from SBI bank (and I believe most Indians have account with SBI bank) It was a calculated risk for him, and unfortunately (for him), no one in my family holds account with SBI bank the moment I said I don’t have account with SBI he disconnected the call So people, if anyone calls you from your bank and asks for any sensitive information, password is not the only sensitive informationIf they ask for your card number, CVV number, OTP sent to your mobile, never share this information -Gaurav

The biggest scam of all times , past , present and future too by our INDIAN RAILWAYS. People suffering from two ways DirectIndirectDirect is paying full fares on RAC tickets. Though it gives an option to travel or not. The facility to book RAC tickets is helpful but losses to people who pay equal fares but not getting equal services. Rac seats are given lower side berth for two people where they can sit or share the berth twin basis. Paying equally but not getting the service equally. Our constitution guarantees RIGHT TO EQUALITY. According to this Railways not treating equally. The same INDIAN RAILWAYS will collect the difference of fare/ taxes when hiked even though the ticket booked prior to hike. On same mechanism the Railway can refund or collect the fare after confirming the seats. Nowadays making refund is also very easy, maximum tickets are booked online and the tickets which booked at the counter can be refunded to their mobile wallets or to their bank account( neft / imps are available ) . The similar rules are applicable to waiting list tickets. Tickets booked online will get refund only on ticket fare. When the passenger is not travelled then service is not completed hence service tax not applicable but we will not get refund on service tax. For over the counter purchased tickets is to be surrendered at least 30 minutes before departure of train. This is with effect from 12th November 2015. After deducting clerical charges remaining will be paid.The passenger who wishes to travel nothing will get and they cannot board reservation coaches. It is good rule not to board the reserved coach here I'm writing about how wait list ticket holders loose money and respect.RAILWAYS can make options for waiting list ticket holders as be book general compartment ticket fare plus reservation charges. If thier ticket is get confirmed the reservation fare can be collected at train. As waiting list ticket holder should travel in general compartment. If he didn't get reservation he doesn't loose anything either cancel or travel in general compartment.INDIRECT Paying more at pantry than prescribed by IRCTC / government. The government can print the meal prices on behind of the ticket but the space will be sold to advertising agencies or irrelevant data or schemes of the government will be printed. Irrelevant means the information of govt schemes may be helpful butHand bills mentioning name of the contractor who has availed the catering services , menu can be displayed or pasted at coaches. Maximum officials know what happens in catering services. Innocent passengers had to suffer all the journey by paying more or making arguments. How we often loose money while reservation in INDIAN RAILWAYS!!!!

I would like to mention multiple instances: MakeMyTrip - Booked hotel and the booking failed. Tried 2 times and same happened. They immediately refunded the amount but noticed that amount refunded was off by a 40 - 50 paise. We would simply ignore such a instance but imagine the amount of money the business made by this. I dropped them note and they refunded the amount saying technical error.MakeMyTrip - Similar instance, difference that I cancelled a 100% refundable hotel. And they refunded amount with 25 - 38p difference for 2 bookings. Awaiting response on this.Subway - The bill was around 310.XX, I gave my card and he charged 311 rs. I confronted saying why didn’t you charge 310rs. And he apologized and refunded 1re. Same thing imagine the money they make doing this.Bangalore Airport - This one is not actually cheating but can lead to one. When I went to park my car the time on slip was 10min less then the actual time. I noted that. On coming out they cut the slip with 10min slow time so no issues. However, consider if actually the time of billing system is correct and the receipt has 10min less time. You may end up paying more. So now I take note of the incoming time and time on receipt everywhere where they charge for parking time based.

These are the biggest phonr scams and fraud, and advice on how to prevent them: Calls purporting to fix an infected PC. The caller asks the victim to visit a website, load a tool, and have their PC taken over remotely. A fee is charged for ‘cleaning’ the PC and the PC may he left with a keyboard logget app that can steal passwords.Calls requesting money from an overseas friend or on their behalf. The caller reports that the victim's son or daughter is stuck overseas and desperately needs funds.You've won a prize or an inheritance or gift, but to claim it, you need to pay a small fee.Your bank account has been compromised. We need your account details and credentials to verify you and clear it up.Report scans and fraud immediately to the police and to your phone service provider. They have procedures to prevent further unwanted calls and help catch the fraudster. To prevent phone scams and fraudulent calls for the elderly or vulnerable person that you care for, visit this post for tips and advice: Prevent Phone Scams and Fraud Calls

Today, I received a message from the e-mail ID <user@airasialimited.com>. The sender claims to be representing AirAsia and talks about how my resume has been shortlisted for a job that I never applied to.  One glance at the message, and grammatical errors and inconsistent font in the mail tell you that this is not a genuine recruitment e-mail. Fine so far. But here comes the SCAM. This job application requires you to deposit INR 9,600 which would be refunded on the day of the interview.They are trying to impersonate some Mr. IR Srinivas. Upon a little reasearch, I found this this person is a real employee at AirAsia serving as the Head - People & Culture. Here is the link to his LinkedIn profile - https://www.linkedin.com/in/irsrinivas/?trk=seokp-title-professional-name. To make things look genuine, the scammer has actually included the link to his LinkedIn profile in the mail that he has sent.The funniest part - the interview is scheduled to be held at Terminal 3, Indira Gandhi International Airport, Delhi which means that in order to be able to collect your refund amount of INR 9,600, you might as well have to buy a ticket worth at least INR 2,000 to be able to enter the airport :P  Scamming taken to the next level. Thanks!

Many of my friends get trapped in this fraud. This is how it happens…. One fine morning you got envelope from post officeYou have to pay atleast Rs. 50 to receive it.Heading of the envelope say: for the post Lower division clerk in XYZ company- direct recruitmentYou are job seeker,you pay the amount and open it.It says: you have been selected from 1000 applicant who has applied for the post 2 years ago.You don't know when you have applied, but selection news force you to accept whatever said without any hesitation.They asked you to send DD in the name of So And So company of Rs. 3500 for pre recruitment process and trainingAfter discussion with one of the elder member of family, you send the DDit has been 2 years passed and you haven't got any news or appointment letter from the companyAnd one more time you blame your luck.Dear friends, We all are well educated, and specially not from rural background. This is may not happen to you. But in my rural INDIA, many of job seekers who haven't got good opportunity for education, who always blame their destiny for not getting job, unemployed or underemployed illiterates are trapped in this fraud. So it is our duty to make them aware of this fraud. “They are not born with bad luck…but lack of knowledge make them feel so.”

KMF Diary scams thousands of farmers. If tou go towards rural areas (I'm talking Karnataka, but it's probably the same story everywhere) you will find milk collection points. Almost every farmer who has some land also has a cow. Many of them give away the milk that they do not consume to these diary collection centers. The quantity of milk could vary from as low as half a liter to many hundred liters. Now heres the scam. The collection centers separate 100 ml from every contribution as testing quantity to check specific gravity. Many small time farmers hardly bring a liter ir two. In that they seperate 100 ml, and this 100 ml is not accounted in the books, but collected all the same! This is done two times a day, each time a collection is made. Poor farmers have to just swallow the loss. But if you remember, even that is not possible. It doesn't make a big difference to large farmers with many cows, but small farmers with just a liter or two, gives aways a liter free for ‘testing’ every 5 days. Its so difficult to believe that in this day and age of technology, state run diaries (with so many sophisticated machines and technology) still adopt such primitive methods to check quality. And we wonder why more farmers are staring at the noose.
