The cab driver called and enquired about the route to reach the location (don't they just follow drop location in map???). Cab has come and I followed it in bike to airport. Since I have to pick my father back home. I parked my bike and reached departure gate where I see driver is arguing with my father that he need to pay 150 /- for toll. We have been to airport multiple times and this was never a case. Intrigued by this, my father sent me with him to exit toll booth and sort out the issue. On the way back to exit driver shouted to me he is driving for 5 years and need to pay toll Everytime and we are dumb people to not understand the basic procedure. Once driver provided the toll slip back in counter the counter representative signaled to go without asking for money as expected by me. Didn't know how to manage driver started saying yesterday I did two drops and both times he had to pay toll from his money. Need to pay toll only if time exceeds 6 minutes and since he is a cab driver he would know this very well. We did not take more than few minutes to load off the luggage and infact he kept arguing for a minute to pay 150/-. Once we are out of the exit, the driver gave back 140 rupees only and insisted the 10 rupees is adjusted in the bill amount. I didn't know the bill amount exactly and tried to verify with my father who used his mobile to book the cab. Within few minutes the driver started scolding bad words (frustration because he couldn't loot the extra 150/-???) . He tried to start the vehicle and drive for his next pick up all these with continuous abuse. Finally I shouted back for trying to loot and head back to departure gate where my relatives are waiting for me. Only then I could see, the a**hole driver has already cancelled the trip and charged estimated amount 350 from my father. My dad is 58 years old and he is not that tech savvy which he took advantage of. Adding to that it is showing 50/- for cancellation charge. So in one trip we faced 1. Unnecessary argument 2. Almost lost 150/- 3. Abuse in bad language 4. Cancellation fee from Ola. What more needed to change mind about Ola? And their drivers? This is not the first time they are trying to loot elderly. Few times drivers had collected toll money from my in-laws who didn't know the ola amount shown is including the toll. Thanks for the Bad night!!! Completely spoiled the mood. Instead of having a peaceful travel, should we worry about drivers also? Note: cancellation charge waived off after contacting support.

I had bought a health insurance policy from LIC of India called Health Plus (Table No. 901) back in 2010. This policy is the first ever Unit Linked Health Insurance Plan. The amount paid towards the premium is used to purchase mutual fund units. It provides Daily Hospitalization Cash Benefit (upto max INR 2500 per day), Major Surgical Benefit and Domiciliary Treatment Benefit. I had to pay a premium of INR 15000 per annum for the same. I was explained that this is not a medical insurance policy but a unit linked health insurance plan (ULIP) that provided the benefits mentioned above that would supplement my medical insurance in case of hospitalization. I received the policy bond as per Table No. 901. However, when I received the policy document, it had Table No. 902 and the name of the policy written on the policy document was Health Protection Plus written on it. I didn’t think too much about it back then. When I wanted to discontinue this policy in 2015, I was expecting the surrender value as per the terms and conditions mentioned in the policy bond (Surrender Value payable only after completion of the third policy anniversary). To my shock, my agent said that there is no surrender possible in this policy which I found quite strange. As per the terms and conditions of Health Protection Plus (Table No. 902), this policy does not have any surrender option and I will only have to stop paying any future premiums. Which is when I realized that I had been sold a different policy altogether with totally different terms and conditions. The agent convinced me that it is still a good policy and continue with this. I thought since I have already paid so many premiums, might as well continue with this. Also the agent pointed out that as per the Domiciliary Treatment Benefit, I can submit my medical bills and claim an amount equal to maximum of 50% of the Policy Fund. Hence I was able to also get some money after submitting my medical bills. A few days back I came across this link in the Hindustan Times wherein a gentleman who had bought the same policy was denied the claim for his wife’s surgery for breast cancer. https://www.hindustantimes.com/mumbai-news/lic-told-to-pay-2-78l-for-misleading-man-over-health-insurance/story-H3xVo2UI3YSy7k4AxMvSLO.html He purchased the policy in 2011 which covered him and his family for assured surgical benefits upto INR 2 lakh. His wife was diagnosed with breast cancer in 2014 for which she underwent surgery and incurred an expense of INR 1.85 lakh. The LIC cleared only INR 2300 (yes, two thousand three hundred rupees only) towards daily cash benefit and rejected the claim for the surgery. However the consumer court ruled in the favour of the complainant as he had been shown the benefits of the policy as per Table 901 (Health Plus) but actual policy was issued as per Table 902. Also the policy did not mention that it did not cover surgery benefit for Cancer surgery. The same thing happened to me as it happened to the couple. Only I was fortunate that I was in good health and was never hospitalized and thus never had to make a claim. LIC of India has discontinued selling this policy since the last few years. There is a pitch created by sales people of LIC of India that since it is a Government company, all the policies are sovereign guaranteed and the claims will be honoured. They also say that the private life insurance companies are crooks and will find technicalities to reject your claim since they are not as financially sound as LIC. Other tactics used by the sales people are Claim Settlement Ratio and sentimental value. Since LIC has a higher CSR they will definitely settle the claim without any delay. In all this we refuse to understand that each death, and therefore each claim settlement is unique. Since your grandparents and your parents bought LIC policies back in the day, you should too as your money is safe and returns on investment guaranteed. Some agents even go to the extent of saying that they are doing this job as a “service to society”. The point I am trying to make here is that the LIC of India is no more ethical than any of the private life insurance companies out there. Request you to please read the terms and conditions of your Insurance policies very carefully before signing the dotted line and know what you are getting into. Treat this like you would any other business transaction and not get carried away by emotion. The next time any LIC agent tries to use emotional blackmail or the CSR point to sell you a policy, tell him/her to go take a hike.

I would like to point out 2 instances while buying a new car, where most people are gullible. Underbody coating - in majority of cases this coating is not required for your car and is advised only in coastal areas because of the presence of salt content (in air and water). Even then underbody coating is not strongly advised. Most of the times, the car dealer advises you to do this because they derive huge commission from this.Also, some car manufacturers already offer some underbody coating straight out of the factory which is usually sprayed inside the wheel arches and under the floor board of the car.Teflon Coating - teflon coating is done on the surface of the car inorder to maintain the shine of the car and to prevent rusting. Most of the times the car dealers offer teflon coating, but where is the proof! . They pass of cheap quality wax as Teflon coating and rip you off and they would not provide any warranty card, which comes with Teflon coating.Links: 1. Pros and cons of underbody coating for cars in India, Teflon paint sealant benefits 2. Teflon Coating For Car or Bike - Waste of money3. Teflon coating - one of the biggest scam ~Joe

One of the biggest scam or fraud is Paytm wallet with their misleading cashBack offer. I recently received a ticket offer IMAGICA1000 stating get flat cash back of Rs 1000 for booking tickets on Insignia Inox. ( No terms and conditions Mentioned ) I booked two tickets on the same and applied the code. Received the confirmation that the code has been successfully applied . Surprise then received another Promo Code IMAGICA1K which has to be used for which cash back will be applicable with numerous terms and conditions. 1.First you need to apply IMAGICA1000 on your movie ticket booking and code is valid only on Minimum two movie tickets bookings. 2.After 24 hours of the successful movie booking you should apply promocode IMAGICA1K on IMAGICA ticket bookings to get flat ?1000 Cashback. 3.IMAGICA1K code will be valid only on Minimum transaction value of Rs.6000. 4.Both offers is valid one time per user. 5.Cashback will be credited within 24 hours of the transaction. 6.Paytm reserves its absolute right to withdraw and/or alter any terms and conditions of the offer at any time without prior notice. 7.Valid Upto 30/09/2017 See how they play around and give one Promocode IMAGICA1000 and then give another promo code IMAGICA1K as a rewards for using the earlier Promocode but no cash back in sight.

Forget Fake Notes & Cards, A 19-Year-Old Chennai Guy Was Arrested For Running A Fake Bank Branch  They say that one should learn from their parents and follow their footsteps. A 19-year-old from Chennai gave it his own twist, when he put the knowledge gained by being around his parents, who were bank employees, and opened his own fake branch . Kamal Babu from Chennai was the mastermind of the plan that also involved 2 other men. They together opened a fake SBI branch in Panruti, Tamil Nadu. And it was all through, as one of the other 2 guys runs his own printing press, while the other makes stamps. They did all this during the lockdown so that the chances of them getting caught were less. However, they forgot it's fake effing bank, not a 'Adibas' cap you find in Sarojini. Obviously someone informed their branch manager about this and the matter escalated. Later, it was found out that no such official branch exists. Then, the help of the police was sought and it was found out that these guys had replicated everything and the interiors looked pretty legitimate, which was shocking for the cops. Anyhow, following that, they were arrested and made to appear before the court.

Scams are spreading rapidly hackers are using your identities to scam others. They collect your details through various tricks including phishing to pilfer your intimate data. Top online scams to businesses include Identity theft, fake documents theft, fake address and stolen identity thefts. Criminals or fraudulent conduct fake credit cards to reserve their order on online stores. Seldomly they use stolen identities to place their order. Both of the time it cost the business owner. If the transaction was fake or the product was delivered to a fraudulent person. Sometimes they have to pay chargebacks and penalties by authorised financial institutions. There are multiple and very smooth solutions. Merchants find them expensive but their results are fruitful that will save you a tremendous amount of money. Online merchants need to install standard KYC program to know their customer and prevent identity theft. If you are a business owner you need to install software to know your customer. Many security companies are providing these services. Some of them verify documents only while others verify identity using 2 verifications or 3 verifications. Some of the companies only verify name, DOB and address but fraudulent are able to provide this information as they can be stolen easily. Shufti Pro is the best company in providing the KYC and AML Compliance program. They implement very strong security checks for identity verification. Even they verify customer by online facial verification that is a very powerful and useful feature of for identity verification as fraudulent can’t cheat facial verification easily.

Large packs of food and cosmetics. Example: 5.5 gm orbit- Rs 5 Each 1 re gives you 1.1 gm.  9.9gm pack - Rs 10 Per 1 re- 0.99gm  19.8gm -Rs 50 Per 1 re you get 0.396 gm  Thus as you buy a larger pack, you are paying more and more. A 50 rs pack (19.8gm) is just giving you 36% of the gum you would get if you bought 10 small packs (55gm) This does not end here, you will see it across all items. Chocolates, toffees ( A 50 Rs family pack of a candy i once bought had just 45 pieces while each candy is sold at 1 re) . Shampoo pouches : if you calculate weight to cost. Bottles are more than double the cost as compared to small single use pouches. Similar trick is followed by brands during festival in name of gift packs. A 500 Rs cadbury gift pack will have only about 400rs worth mrp of chocolates. And we always thought buying in bulk saves money. Image source: screenshots from amazon now.

Mails & message promising job/job interview in top companies and asking to deposit a refundable money in their account. Today only my friend received this link: http://larsentoubroconstructionsltd-hr012.blogspot.in/2017/09/www.larsentoubrolimited.com.html?m=1  Now, this letter says to deposit a specific amount and last day to do so is today itself. Means u don't get enough time to think or consult others and do what they say. When registering for a gas connection we have to provide our full address to our nearest gas concern which includes the floor in which you live. Irrespective of this when the gas delivery boy comes he charges you extra for lifting the cylinder up the stairs or even if he uses the lift.We normally pay Rs10 extra for the work they are doing considering cylinders are heavy and all stuff but we are not liable to pay as we had mentioned our full address while applying for the connection. Recently the gas delivery boys are not happy with Rs10 and on an average ask Rs30 for each gas irrespective of whether it is ground floor or 3rd floor. Considering the fact a delivery boy delivers around 30cylinders per day just calculate his income per day Rs30*30cylinders*30days=Rs27000. I dont know in what ratio this is shared by the gas delivery boy and the gas agency but it is a big scam worth mentioning http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/karnataka/dont-let-lpg-delivery-boys-take-you-for-a-ride/article8334211.ece

This is related to uber. Incident: I live in Bangalore.Yesterdayy i booked a cab (uber XL) from BTM Layout to Infosys gate in electronic city. So initially the estimated fare was showing around 390. While coming we told driver to take flyover as we were getting late for offie . Driver paid the toll fee which was Rs.45. So when we reached the destination the bill was Rs. 435. But driver insisted us to pay 480 as he paid for the toll. But we knew it is added to final bill as it is the policy of uber. When we asked him he started arguing in kannada & showed the trip bill which was displaying toll fee as Rs.0 . So one of our colleague who is from Bangalore ,she asked him in kannada. Then the driver gave some bullshit reason saying if you go to airport area then uber final bill will include the toll fee , otherwise throughout the Bangalore you have to pay for toll. We were in a hurry, so we paid and left. Later when enquired about this with customer care of uber, they told us it was a mistake on our part to give 480 instead of 435 and also told if we would have paid via wallet they would have refunded the extra amount.  Beware guys. Pay the exact amount which comes in bill.

The income certificate Fraud during admission to India's premiere institutes. Admission to the India's premiere institutes like the IITs, NITs etc is always a dream for every aspirant preparing for engineering entrance examinations. But apart from category reservation in which a student having rank>1lakh gets his stream of choice and college whereas students having pretty better ranks than that guy struggle to get a college. But here, I am not taking this thing into the account, I am talking about the fraud that is prevalent during taking admission into these colleges, THE INCOME CERTIFICATE FRAUD. There is a certain fee waiver for each payment slab during admission 1) Family Income<1lakh and 2) 1lakh<Family income<5lakhs. I was shocked to see that most of the students who were carrying expensive smartphones, wearing branded clothes have stated their family income to be less than 1lakh in order to take that fee waiver and some of them have showed less than 5 lakhs. Most of these students had a family business or their parents were working in a private firm, I still wonder, which job pays so less that the overall family income is too low and even after that their members carry smartphones and laptops. Coming from a middle class family,this hurts a lot as you see your parents making Sacrifices for you and paying the whole fee by themselves even my family income is slightly greater than 6lakhs. These income certificates can be made at a small bribe and you can mention any amount of money you want as your family income (one of the guys had mentioned 60k per annum and owns a 42k laptop and 25k smartphone). The government must take sincere efforts to look into the matter so that only those who deserve to get a waiver should get it.

response.answer_text: clean master.  Just look at it's rating and number of download it has. Clean master cleans cache memory. The thing is, android does not need apps like these.when android is low on memory, it cleans the app cache on it's own. Clean master kills background apps. When you kill a app doing nothing in background and then you open it again, it puts load on your processor and slows down your phone. This is what clean master does it slows down your phone.

The biggest scam today are the fraud calls regarding job. These people get the data from online job portals and call people offering fake jobs. There is usually a lady speaking in typical Delhi accent and the first thing they say is that they saw your resume on somewhere.com, can you please tell me what degree have you completed. ( Excuse me, RESUME). Then they'll tell you that you've been shortlisted for BMW, TATA, ASHOK LEYLAND and L&T. Company, job position and location of your choice. Even if your state doesn't have a BMW plant, they'll make sure it is. After all that, the main purpose of their call “ A refundable deposit”. It's usually an amount of 2k-3k that must be payed through Paytm. ( Even then some people traps into it). Apart from calls, they also send emails claiming that they are these big companies and ask for money. Don't know from where these people operate but when asked they usually say Noida, Delhi. This is one of the biggest scam operating nowadays. If anybody knows a way to catch this fraudsters, your comments are welcomed. And for the people who still fall in this trap and pays them, salute to you.

Today I went to one of famous restaurants Shah Ghouse in Hyderabad with my friends. We ordered Biryani and Cold drinks. After seeing the bill I noticed they charged Rs 20/Bottle for Cold Drink of Rs 18/Bottle and additionally the are adding 18% GST on it.  MRP: Rs 18, Charging Rs 20 , After GST (18%) 20 + 3.6= Rs 23.6 So Rs 18 bottle now becomes Rs 23.6 They are earning extra profit Rs.5.6/bottle. Edit: After discussing the issue with manager I was told that extra Rs 2 is cooling charges and they are paying the same GST.

Have you heard of Tade/Import parity pricing mechanism in petroleum products (Petrol & Deisel) being sold in India. For your read & research below is a link to the details: The logic of trade-parity pricing Why I consider this as one of the biggest scams is because it is a formula that government given to oil companies to include imaginary expenses while calculating the price a consumer will have to pay, and then on these imaginary expenses- A consumer pays almost 100%taxes to central and state governments. Taxes goes to the government, even the inflated prices calculated from trade parity pricing mechanism also goes to the government of India in form of dividends from the oil companies.
